title: J.B. Hunt Q3 profit misses Wall Street targets
text:
J.B. Hunt Transport Services Inc., considered a freight-industry bellwether, reported third-quarter results Tuesday. Here's what you need to know:

EARNINGS: Profit rose to $151.2 million, or $1.40 a share, from $131.1 million, or $1.19 a share, a year earlier. Analysts surveyed by FactSet expect profit to come in at about $1.44 a share.

REVENUE FORECAST: Operating revenue rose to $2.36 billion from $2.21 billion, beating the consensus of $2.34 billion.

INTERMODAL: Segment revenue rose 1.8% to $1.24 billion, slightly below analysts' projections. The results reflected roughly flat volumes from the comparable period a year earlier and about a 2% increase in revenue per load. Operating income improved to $132.9 million, beating analysts' projected $136.5 million.

BNSF: J.B. Hunt didn't update the status of a freight revenue dispute with BNSF Railway, its partner in the intermodal business. The matter is in arbitration, and J.B. Hunt has taken more than $100 million in contingency charges.

Write to Maria Armental at maria.armental@wsj.com
